result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamee J Jacobi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 7/16/2015 at 3:00 PM.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution joint and several with co-actor, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Obtain high school diploma or GED/HSED.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with the victim, co-actor or defendants biological mother.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must write a minimum 100 word apology letter to the victim. This to be done within the first 30 days of probation.

timeConds.notes: 6 months stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. To commence forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol, except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
To pay restitution owing plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

records.addlTxt: Transcript - Sentencing Hearing on Revocation held 1-22-2021
Zoom hearing / Door County Jail

01:30 PM Defendant Jamee J Jacobi appeared via zoom from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared via zoom.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense joins in sentencing recommendation, makes statement.   Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 22, 2021 at 01:30 pm.  THIS HEARING IS BEING SCHEDULED AS A ZOOM HEARING.  PARTIES PLEASE FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS FOR HOW TO APPEAR REMOTELY ATTACHED.

02:50 PM Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC agent Kim Bridenhagen present in court.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.   Court questions defendant on where he's at with payment of restitution. Defendant is only working part-time at the English Inn, will be working full-time starting in June.  Defendant indicates he just got out of rehab, that's why he hasn't paid anything toward restitution.  Agent Bridenhagen indicates last 4 years with defendant have been a struggle.  Defendant was close to being revoked when ATR was given to defendant for inpatient rehab.  Defendant is feeling better about himself and hopes to continue on the right path.  Court advises defendant to continue working with DOC to get his GED, find housing, get a good job.  Court would like to see at least $1,000 paid toward restitution in the next year.  Court won't schedule another PRH, Agent Brigenhagen can request hearing if she feels one is needed.
Order extending probation
and stipulation to waive appearance and hearing
Subpoena - Probation Hrg Review
Probation review hearing on February 18, 2019 at 02:45 pm.
Request for Probation Review Hearing.                          Sheryl:  Set probation review hearing.  DTE

ADDRESS INFO for Jamee J Jacobi
Current: 216 N 18th Ave. Apt J, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 09-16-2015)
Prior: 444 N. 7th Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Kim Bridenhagen present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions defendant on how he's doing on probation. Defendant feels probation is going pretty well. Defendant has a few struggles, looking for permanent housing and work. Defendant indicates he hasn't paid anything toward restitution. Agent Bridenhagen indicates defendant needs to establish housing/work and then needs to set up payment plan to pay his financial obligations. Agent Bridenhagen feels defendant is doing fairly well on probation, he's moving in the right direction. Atty Pelrine makes statement. Court encourages defendant to find a job and place to live and then try to work on other conditions of probation. Court won't set another probation review hearing unless agent requests one.
Restitution summary

Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State advises of housekeeping matter. Date of conviction for Arizona charge should be 9/30/13 not 9/30/12. So noted by the Court. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders Defendant to submit DNA sample if one hasn't already been done. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in court with attorney Stephen P. Johnson.  Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Johnson requests a status within 30 days, some progress has been toward resolving the matter.  Bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defense Discovery Demand
State's Discovery Demand
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in court with attorney Stephen P. Johnson.  Defendant Jamee J Jacobi in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jamee J Jacobi appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
